original: Kjellstrand, Stig Harald, lektor, Borås, f. 17/11/97 i Sthlm av bankdir. Frans K. o. Agnes Andersson. G. 1. 33-41 m. Dorothy Quarles; 2. 45 m. Nellie Ei.sner. Barn: Anne f. 34, Peggy 36. — Stud:ex. i Sthlm 16, STH 17, civ:ing:ex. v. KTH 21, ex. v. Preusis. Höh. Fachschule f. TextiHnd. i M. Gladbach 29. Res. t. USA 22-29, Tyskl. 30, Engl. 30, Tyskl., Österr., Schweiz o. Ital. 31. Ing. v. Sv. Soc-kerfabr. A-B 21-22, chief chem. v. Spreckeb Sugar Co. i Calif. 22-27, Im-hoff Berg Silk Dyeing Co. i Pater-son, N. J., USA, 27-29’, lekt. i textil tekn. v. Borås tekn. gymn. >sed. 34. Förest, f. textilinst. i Borås 31-43, f. ■desis materialprovn :anst. sed. 31. Skr.: Textila råmaterial (39), Textil varukunskap (40), medarb. i olika upp-slagsb., vet:skapl. o. tekn. upps. i fack-tidskr.
translated: Kjellstrand, Stig Harald, lecturer, Borås, b. 17/11/97 in Stockholm, son of bank director Frans K. and Agnes Andersson. Married 1. 33-41 to Dorothy Quarles; 2. 45 to Nellie Eisner. Children: Anne b. 34, Peggy b. 36. Education: completed upper secondary school in Stockholm in 1916, further studies in 1917, civil engineer's degree from the Royal Institute of Technology in 1921, and completed studies at Preusis. Higher technical school for textile industry in Mönchengladbach in 1929. Resided in the USA from 1922-1929, Germany in 1930, England in 1930, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, and Italy in 1931. Worked as an engineer at the Swedish Sugar Company A-B from 1921-1922, chief chemist at Spreckeb Sugar Co. in California from 1922-1927, Imhoff Berg Silk Dyeing Co. in Paterson, N.J., USA from 1927-1929, and as a lecturer in textile technology at Borås Technical Gymnasium from 1934. Head of the textile institute in Borås from 1931-1943, and head of the material testing department since 1931. Published works: Textile Raw Materials (1939), Textile Science (1940), and collaborated in various reference books, scientific and technical articles in specialist journals.
